verses.verse: When <WH3588> thou sittest<WH3427> to eat<WH3898> with<WH854> a ruler,<WH4910> consider diligently<WH995> <WH995> <WH853> what<WH834> is before<WH6440> thee:
And put<WH7760> a knife<WH7915> to thy throat,<WH3930> if<WH518> thou<WH859> be a man<WH1167> given to appetite.<WH5315>
Be not<WH408> desirous<WH183> of his dainties:<WH4303> for they<WH1931> are deceitful<WH3577> meat.<WH3899>
Labor <WH3021> not<WH408> to be rich:<WH6238> cease<WH2308> from<WH4480> thine own wisdom.<WH998>

Wilt thou set<WH5774> thine eyes<WH5869> upon that which is not?<WH369> for<WH3588> riches certainly make<WH6213> <WH6213> themselves wings;<WH3671> they fly away<WH5774> as an eagle<WH5404> toward heaven.<WH8064>
Eat <WH3898> thou not<WH408> <WH853> the bread<WH3899> of him that hath an evil<WH7451> eye,<WH5869> neither<WH408> desire<WH183> thou his dainty meats: <WH4303>

For <WH3588> as<WH3644> he thinketh<WH8176> in his heart,<WH5315> so<WH3651> is he:<WH1931> Eat<WH398> and drink,<WH8354> saith<WH559> he to thee; but his heart<WH3820> is not<WH1077> with thee.<WH5973>
The morsel<WH6595> which thou hast eaten<WH398> shalt thou vomit up,<WH6958> and lose<WH7843> thy sweet<WH5273> words.<WH1697>
Speak <WH1696> not<WH408> in the ears<WH241> of a fool:<WH3684> for<WH3588> he will despise<WH936> the wisdom<WH7922> of thy words.<WH4405>
Remove <WH5253> not<WH408> the old<WH5769> landmark;<WH1366> and enter<WH935> not<WH408> into the fields<WH7704> of the fatherless: <WH3490>
For <WH3588> their redeemer<WH1350> is mighty;<WH2389> he<WH1931> shall plead<WH7378> <WH853> their cause<WH7379> with<WH854> thee.
Apply <WH935> thine heart<WH3820> unto instruction,<WH4148> and thine ears<WH241> to the words<WH561> of knowledge.<WH1847>
Withhold <WH4513> not<WH408> correction<WH4148> from the child:<WH4480> <WH5288> for<WH3588> if thou beatest<WH5221> him with the rod,<WH7626> he shall not<WH3808> die.<WH4191>
Thou <WH859> shalt beat<WH5221> him with the rod,<WH7626> and shalt deliver<WH5337> his soul<WH5315> from hell.<WH4480> <WH7585>
My son,<WH1121> if<WH518> thine heart<WH3820> be wise,<WH2449> my heart<WH3820> shall rejoice,<WH8055> even<WH1571> mine.<WH589>
Yea, my reins<WH3629> shall rejoice,<WH5937> when thy lips<WH8193> speak<WH1696> right things.<WH4339>
Let not<WH408> thine heart<WH3820> envy<WH7065> sinners:<WH2400> but<WH3588> be thou in the fear<WH3374> of the LORD<WH3068> all<WH3605> the day<WH3117> long.
For <WH3588> surely<WH518> there is<WH3426> an end;<WH319> and thine expectation<WH8615> shall not<WH3808> be cut off.<WH3772>
Hear <WH8085> thou,<WH859> my son,<WH1121> and be wise,<WH2449> and guide<WH833> thine heart<WH3820> in the way.<WH1870>
Be <WH1961> not<WH408> among winebibbers;<WH5433> <WH3196> among riotous eaters<WH2151> of flesh: <WH1320>
For <WH3588> the drunkard<WH5433> and the glutton<WH2151> shall come to poverty:<WH3423> and drowsiness<WH5124> shall clothe<WH3847> a man with rags.<WH7168>
Hearken <WH8085> unto thy father<WH1> that<WH2088> begot<WH3205> thee, and despise<WH936> not<WH408> thy mother<WH517> when<WH3588> she is old.<WH2204>
Buy <WH7069> the truth,<WH571> and sell<WH4376> it not;<WH408> also wisdom,<WH2451> and instruction,<WH4148> and understanding.<WH998>
The father<WH1> of the righteous<WH6662> shall greatly rejoice:<WH1523> <WH1523> and he that begetteth<WH3205> a wise<WH2450> child shall have joy<WH8055> of him.
Thy father<WH1> and thy mother<WH517> shall be glad,<WH8055> and she that bore<WH3205> thee shall rejoice.<WH1523>
My son,<WH1121> give<WH5414> me thine heart,<WH3820> and let thine eyes<WH5869> observe<WH5341> my ways.<WH1870>
For <WH3588> a whore<WH2181> is a deep<WH6013> ditch;<WH7745> and a strange<WH5237> woman is a narrow<WH6862> pit.<WH875>
She <WH1931> also<WH637> lieth in wait<WH693> as for a prey,<WH2863> and increaseth<WH3254> the transgressors<WH898> among men.<WH120>

Who <WH4310> hath woe?<WH188> who<WH4310> hath sorrow?<WH17> who<WH4310> hath contentions?<WH4079> who<WH4310> hath babbling?<WH7879> who<WH4310> hath wounds<WH6482> without cause?<WH2600> who<WH4310> hath redness<WH2448> of eyes?<WH5869>
They that tarry long<WH309> at<WH5921> the wine;<WH3196> they that go<WH935> to seek<WH2713> mixed wine.<WH4469>
Look <WH7200> not<WH408> thou upon the wine<WH3196> when<WH3588> it is red,<WH119> when<WH3588> it giveth<WH5414> his color<WH5869> in the cup,<WH3563> when it moveth itself<WH1980> aright.<WH4339>
At the last<WH319> it biteth<WH5391> like a serpent,<WH5175> and stingeth<WH6567> like an adder.<WH6848>
Thine eyes<WH5869> shall behold<WH7200> strange women,<WH2114> and thine heart<WH3820> shall utter<WH1696> perverse things.<WH8419>
Yea, thou shalt be<WH1961> as he that lieth down<WH7901> in the midst<WH3820> of the sea,<WH3220> or as he that lieth<WH7901> upon the top<WH7218> of a mast.<WH2260>

They have stricken<WH5221> me, shalt thou say, and I was not<WH1077> sick;<WH2470> they have beaten<WH1986> me, and I felt<WH3045> it not:<WH1077> when<WH4970> shall I awake?<WH6974> I will seek<WH1245> it yet<WH3254> again.<WH5750>
